prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Central Hole** Construct a cylindrical object with a central hole. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. *Sketch*: In the XY plane, create two circles for the face\\_1. *Loop 1*: Create a circle (circle\\_1) with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375. *Loop 2*: Create a circle (circle\\_1) with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.3. For the *Extrusion*, set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.075, and the sketch scale to 0.75. Finally, perform a new body operation with the preceding CAD models. **Part 2: Top Section of the Cylindrical Object** Create the top section of the cylindrical object. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.075, 0.075, 0.0. *Sketch*: In the XY plane, create two circles for the face\\_1. *Loop 1*: Create a circle (circle\\_1) with a center at [0.3, 0.3] and a radius of 0.3. *Loop 2*: Create a circle (circle\\_1) with a center at [0.3, 0.3] and a radius of 0.225. For the *Extrusion*, set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.6, and the sketch scale to 0.6. Then, join the current sketch with the previously constructed CAD models. Height of part\\_1: 0.075 m, width of part\\_1: 0.075 m, height of part\\_1: 0.075 m Height of part\\_2: 0.6 m, width of part\\_2: 0.6 m, height of part\\_2: 0.6 m The final shape will have the combined height, width, and length of part\\_1 and part\\_2.</description>

Extrude the scaled 2D sketch with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.0938 * Extrude depth opposite the normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 The resulting part should have the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.0938 Note that the shape of this part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section.</description>
